text: This is a really neat exercise. Reminds me of the ad agency I used to work for - they had a positioning statement that was formulated as "For [Target Audience] who [Audience Need], [Insert Product Here] is a [Product Class Descriptor] that [Does X Useful Thing] by [Reason To Believe].

elements.text: This is a really neat exercise. Reminds me of the ad agency I used to work for - they had a positioning statement that was formulated as "For [Target Audience] who [Audience Need], [Insert Product Here] is a [Product Class Descriptor] that [Does X Useful Thing] by [Reason To Believe].

text: But yours is oriented toward action - what you want to get the target audience to _do._ Which definitely feels more clarifying for marketers

elements.text: But yours is oriented toward action - what you want to get the target audience to
Which definitely feels more clarifying for marketers

text: Thanks Katie :slightly_smiling_face: yeah, I thiiiiink that positioning statement is more or less Geoffrey Moore's positioning statement recipe from Crossing the Chasm (1991). I believe versions of it existed before as well, would be interesting to track their origins down

elements.text: yeah, I thiiiiink that positioning statement is more or less Geoffrey Moore's positioning statement recipe from Crossing the Chasm (1991). I believe versions of it existed before as well, would be interesting to track their origins down

text:
Hey folks, this is on behalf of some friends of mine that are running an early stage start up and 2019 MassChallenge Finalist who have launched their product, Considdr. Considdr helps content marketers deliver meaningful topic research in less time. Rather than giving you links to documents to go and wade through yourself, Considdr returns high quality, reliable insights that have been automatically extracted from those documents, saving time in attaining actionable data points, and helping you uncover information you may not otherwise have found.

_My personal take: You know when you're looking for research to back up your point of view when writing an article and the Google results seem to point to all low tier blog or consultant's personal blog and you need a more reputable source? Well, Considdr will help surface insights and research papers/statistics that are much easier to filter than traipsing through Google hoping you'll land on something you can cite, quote, or link to._

Considdr are currently offering free pilots to everyone, where you will get unlimited access to the product for as many team members as you’d like for 30 days.

Free trial link: <https://www.considdr.com/#request-demo>
